post.body: Gotta love Tampopo -- Actually reminds me of Babettes. Can't get the scene with the shrimp out of my mind...
Howdy -- Had to follow after reading of you in Julio Ojeda's book. Now, back to reading...
Congrats on the new site's public debut -- I shall look forward to socializing accordingly!
Have you made the Snidely Whiplash noise while writing exams yet?
"being brief" - I agree, but I also think enforced brevity is a good tool to force us to speak clearly. Here's to 140!
re-plaxo, et al: somebody will take over from current kings, but not a 'me too' provider. I scope new guys but usually move on.
humidifiers-depends on the brand and design, but make sure you're changing the filters on schedule. I won't give mine up!
Sony Music violated COPPA - know that under-13ers registered and posted info about themselves, etc. See http://bit.ly/N250
Did you do the SONY COPPA story yet? (Didn't listen this AM...)
Re long name -- I'm married to a Heidenreich, so I know of what you speak!
Radio Heartland will be a nice addition, but sad to note that it follows loss of The Morning Show.
ANYWAY -- I think we're more on the same page than off it -- I was just playing on the edges and seeing what I thought.
The problem with metaphors is they eventually lead to one wondering which meme the green elf was supposed to represent...
big diff btwn Wild Wild West versus World Wide Web: in old days, only one interest group had all the information. Not so now.
BUT, eventually, Cheyenne gives way to those who demand rules, sheriffs and courts. "Web" is well on that path even now.
I think the 'Cheyenne' factor was like Web:people need a place to interact and do business, even where there are risks.
"old west" analogy I buy -- Then, we ask why certain places succeeded in spite of lack of law or rules.
I'd focus on the difference, since land is a scarce resource which must be allocated while the web has no natural limits.
Web + Law = Tricky :: For certain. Not sure I follow the real estate reference though...
I offer no advice in those endeavours my friend...
There. You now have your own nomination as well, so you're not totally shut out. ;-) ®
I nominate @FredFaulknerIV for a Shorty Award in #socialmedia because he's dragging the legal profession into this century
I meant the Journal dude... Just the figurative 'you'. Sorry for the confusion...
Consider yourself nominated for a Shorty.
Sack is truly a great one we're proud of here in MSP. If he's going it's probably a sign that the Strib is close to terminal.
I nominate @ABAJournal for a Shorty Award in #news because it's fast and gets me a broad spectrum of news.
My first and best viewing of Stop Making Sense was a midnight showing at the Uptown. Still, that is the best concert movie ever.
I was actually trying to consider if the Walser ad was a parody. Maybe best to stay in the sports section.
But for those of us who can remember @lileks for his days at the Minnesota Daily, he's still a Gopher at heart... Where's Elmo?
Pleasure to buy your book. Now, to convince my employer of the virtues...
Minnesota = 'city'? (Not to be a jerk -- Actually I'm interested to hear if that's a state accomplishment or just of Mpls.)
Coffee sans coffee beans-Must be something in the air. I did that on Saturday!
Snowblowers? We don't need no stinkin' blowers. Lifting snow for an hour counts as a cardio session! Skip a trip to the gym!
Read § 512(i)(1)(A), as well as § 512(a), and think carefully about the real reasons behind their strategy shift...
RIAA announces its change in litigation strategy... http://tinyurl.com/3jn387
How many know that the F in PF Chang is 'Fleming'? Sadly, no relation... They have a new semi-quick concept here called Pei Wei. Prty good
The USA health system is too dependent on the patient's self tracking. Auto guys know more about my car than docs know about me.
Wow. What a weird feeling to walk the halls of my (law) alma mater.
Remember-Shovel your sidewalks! It's the law!
Car door latches, water, 10 degrees fahrenheit. These things do not play well together.
Digesting still...
Happy #Thanksgiving to USA friends!
Overheard a guy scamming somebody into a pyramid scheme ("too complex to explain" was his line). Should I reach out and interrupt such?
The restaurant here at work has been closed since Nov 1. Sort of a blessing from a culinary viewpoint, but it's getting tiresome to go out.
So, why is @cnnbrk following imajes? (Not that there's anything wrong with that...)
First grader birthday parties-They're not so easy to control anymore...
Mmmmm... Sashimi!
Wooters - The wootoffs today are fast and furious. Interesting items (and plenty of carp as well). Woot.com
FTC shutting down bogus computer scanners WinFixer, WinAntivirus, DriveCleaner, ErrorSafe, and XP Antivirus. http://bit.ly/QPJq
ok -- it really doesn't work...
track minnesota
Loop Bar & Grille in North Loop Minneapolis- Loud and post-college, and free wifi. Good place to wait for a friend.
Sony COPPA enforcement order-Was there a disconnect btwn the lawyers and those who built the sites? What should we learn from this?
#mima if you stand at the foot of the statue and say Tweet, I might say hi to you
#Mima Finding right foor to City Hall is a challenge (if you didn't read the invite carefully).
Google pinky-swears that it still stands behind Net Neutrality principles. http://tinyurl.com/6os8tx
We were girded up for a cold one last night, but it was a balmy -8 F when I woke up. Nothing frozen that shouldn't be.
A summary of WSJ net neutrality kaffuffle. Google going to the other side? Maybe not. http://www.talkingpointsmemo.com/archives/248156.php
Byerly's bakery is tempting me to go over my carb allowance...
Is it a compliment to an 8th grader to suggest her hair looks like Amy Winehouse?
Guinness... Maybe the finest calming device invented to date...
Who in their right mind scheduled a holiday on a Thursday and expected Friday to be a workday?
Australia to censor the Internet. http://tinyurl.com/765oly
My, how it does hurt when the right advice to give to the client is not to do anything about a problem. I best believe in good karma...
Enjoying new Philadelphia International box set. Get on Love Train! http://tinyurl.com/6t7mbl
Merry Christmas to all. And to all -- A good night.
Ack! #Santa has made it to Grenada! I better get to bed soon or he'll skip Minnesota...
It still amazes me that American businesses ever manage to stay in business...
Minnesota Rules: On Sunday, an invite to 'dinner' means the afternoon, not the evening meal. (Now when do I get my work done?)
